description: '''Kavigan''' ({{langx|bn|কবিগান}}), '''Kobi Gaan''', '''Kobi Lorai''' or '''Kabigan''' is a form of [[Bengali language|Bengali]] folk performance wherein folk poets sing and perform. A verbal duel among the poets, this mystic minstrels art was popular with rural folk form in nineteenth century in [[Bengal]] region, which includes the [[India|Indian state]] of [[West Bengal]] and [[Bangladesh]].{{failed verification|date=November 2018}}. The mythological themes from both Hindu and Muslims religious texts were commonly used for Kobi Gaan.
